intro: Acrostichum craspedariiforme, commonly known as the narrow-leaf brake, is a fern native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Blechnaceae and is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant has a creeping rhizome and produces sporangia on the underside of its fronds. Its foliage is often used in horticulture for ornamental purposes. The species is adapted to moist, shaded environments and thrives in humid climates.
